alert.note: Alert for Mora; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 8:07PM MDT until June 16 at 9:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE HERMITS PEAK-CALF CANYON BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN MORA AND NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTIES... At 807 PM MDT, Doppler radar continued to indicate heavy rain over the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon Wildfire Burn Scar with new thunderstorms developing over the area. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain are estimated to have fallen already, and additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in parts of the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Excessive rainfall over the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon Burn Scar will impact Sapello River and nearby creeks. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon Burn Scar with possible debris flows. The debris flows can consist of large masses of water ash, soot, burned wildfire debris, rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sapello, Tierra Monte, Ledoux, Morphy Lake State Park, Gascon, Watrous, Manuelitas, San Ignacio in Guadalupe County, South Carmen, Rociada and Monte Aplanado. This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 17. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 9 and 20. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn area. To report flooding, contact the National Weather Service office in Albuquerque at 1.888.386.7637 when you can do so safely.
